comments:
I can't quite figure out what is causing this problem, but it happens often
(approx 1/2 the time).  When I start up Eclipse, I get an error stating "Unable
to read workbench state. Workbench UI layout will be reset.".  The stack trace
indicates an ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException in
NavigationHistory.restoreState(IMemento).  I debugged this and found there are 2
objects in the "items" array.  Here's what the details pane of the variables
view showed for these objects...

<item historyLabel="emptyModel1.logic" index="0" />
<item active="true" historyLabel="emptyModel1.logic" index="-1" />

The second one is causing the error with its index of -1.  Sometimes there's
only the first object in this array and no error occurs.  


Here's the stack trace...

!SESSION Mar 17, 2003 11:15:56.932 ---------------------------------------------
java.version=1.4.1_01

-configuration

-install file:C:/Eclipse_2.1_RC2/

!MESSAGE Problems occurred when invoking code from plug-in:
"org.eclipse.ui.workbench".
!STACK 0

Looks like a duplicate of bug #34142, which was fixed in R2.1, RC2 
(I20030312).  Which build are you using?

Sorry.  I did a search for "NavigationHistory" and bug 34142 didn't come up. 
I'm using the RC2 build (200303071024).  I'll just wait for RC3 and verify then.
 Thanks.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 34142 ***
